The greatest judges among the psychopomps are the massive yamarajes, whose wisdom is legendary and whose edicts are unappealable except to ushers or [Pharasma](/Deities.aspx?ID=14) herself. A yamaraj resembles an immense dragon with dark, feathery scales and an emotionless, dispassionate gaze behind a feathered mask. When not serving as the senior magistrates, lords, and generals of the [Boneyard](/Planes.aspx?ID=15), yamarajes pursue highly individualistic hobbies, such as gardening or literature. They are willing to halt in their duties to converse with mortals whose expertise matches their interests. **[Recall Knowledge - Monitor](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 42 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 40 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 [Yamaraj](/Monsters.aspx?ID=770) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 211 2.0 **Perception** +37; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [lifesense 240 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=21), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Requian](/Languages.aspx?ID=34); [telepathy 120 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37), [_tongues_](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +33, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +36, [Boneyard Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +40, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +34, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +34, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +36, [Legal Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +40, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +38, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +38, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +38 **Str** +10 **Dex** +7 **Con** +7 **Int** +10 **Wis** +7 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 45 **Fort** +33 **Ref** +31 **Will** +35 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 375 ([fast healing 20](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15), lightning drinker) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), electricity (see lightning drinker) **Resistances** negative 20, poison 20 **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 60 feet, DC 39
**Lightning Drinker** Whenever a yamaraj would take electricity damage if not for its immunity, its fast healing increases to 40 on its next turn. During that turn, if it uses its breath weapon, the beetles crackle with electricity and deal 2d12 additional electricity damage. --- **Speed** 35 feet, fly 50 feet, swim 30 feet **Melee** jaws +38 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d8+18 piercing plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) and yamaraj venom and spirit touch **Melee** claw +38 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d4+18 slashing plus spirit touch **Melee** tail +38 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d10+18 bludgeoning plus spirit touch **Divine Innate Spells** DC 44 - **5th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will), [Mind Probe](/Spells.aspx?ID=193) (at will) - **8th** [Chain Lightning](/Spells.aspx?ID=33) (×3), [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78) (×3), [Spirit Song](/Spells.aspx?ID=303), [Wall of Force](/Spells.aspx?ID=363) - **9th** [Bind Soul](/Spells.aspx?ID=21), [Harm](/Spells.aspx?ID=146), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148), [Wail of the Banshee](/Spells.aspx?ID=361) - **10th** [Miracle](/Spells.aspx?ID=196), [Revival](/Spells.aspx?ID=262) - **Constant (10th)** [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Rituals** DC 44 - **5th** [Call Spirit](/Rituals.aspx?ID=5), [Resurrect](/Rituals.aspx?ID=20) **Breath Weapon** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) The yamaraj breathes a blast of beetles in a 50-foot cone that deals 14d8 slashing damage and 4d8 [persistent slashing damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) to creatures in the area (DC 42 Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds.
**Critical Success** The creature takes no damage.
**Success** The creature takes half damage and is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34).
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is sickened 2.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is sickened 3. **Final Judgment** A yamaraj's miracle spells are used only to pronounce judgment, typically either to restore a dead or destroyed creature to life, bind a creature to the [Boneyard](/Planes.aspx?ID=15), or banish a creature from the Boneyard. **Spirit Touch** A yamaraj's Strikes affect [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=222) creatures with the effects of a [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) property rune and deal 3d6 negative damage to living creatures and 3d6 positive damage to undead. **Yamaraj Venom** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) While a creature is [clumsy](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) from this poison, it is [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9) with the same value; **Saving Throw** DC 42 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 10 rounds; **Stage 1** 3d8 poison damage and clumsy 1 (1 round); **Stage 2** 5d8 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round); **Stage 3** 7d8 poison damage and clumsy 3 (1 round)
